bioghist.p: Sadie Bell was a graduate of Bryn Mawr College, receiving her bachelor's degree in 1912 and her master's in 1913. She received her Ph.D. from the University of Pennsylvania in 1929. Her dissertation, entitled The Church, the State, and Education in Virginia, was published in 1930. She went on to teach high school and junior high school in West Virginia.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of research and bibliographic notes and manuscript copies of Sadie Bell's Ph.D. dissertation. There are also clippings and articles, related to the legal aspects of religion in education, including a number of items on the 1925 "Scopes Monkey Trial."

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
